lead_paragraph: In an article in this Sunday’s issue of The New York Times Magazine, Andrew Rice writes about Sam Apple, a writer and Web site director who quit his job to become a latter-day newspaper entrepreneur. Using customized open-source software, he started an online publication he calls The Faster Times, an attempt to keep newspaper-style journalism alive in a Web-only version. Instead of paying his writers a salary or a flat freelance fee, Mr. Apple shares advertising revenue with them — a small amount at the moment, but potentially more lucrative if the enterprise takes off.

headline.main: Sunday Magazine Preview: A New-Style Newspaper Entrepreneur

abstract: The fight over Flash multimedia software took a new turn with an advertising campaign from Adobe.
snippet: The fight over Flash multimedia software took a new turn with an advertising campaign from Adobe.
lead_paragraph: Adobe, the software company, began a nationwide, multi-Web site advertising campaign on Thursday criticizing Apple’s refusal to allow the Adobe multimedia Flash software on the iPhone and iPad.

headline.main: Next Round in the Adobe-Apple Fight
